bio: Best friends Amy Poehler & Meredith Walker created Smart Girls to celebrate your truest self. Why? Because you change the world by being yourself! 💕🦄

Repost from @splcenter : .
.
The Department of Justice is asking the Supreme Court to hurry up and rule on the president's proposed ban on trans military members by bypassing lower courts. This not only requires an exception to our judicial process, but it threatens the visibility and livelihoods of people who have served dutifully. Thousands of transgender people are serving with honor and courage. How dare the president suggest otherwise? .
.
#WontBeErased #YallMeansAll #TheMarchContinues

Repost from @tooyoungtowed . Link in bio to support 👆
•
A nutritious breakfast can can be life-changing for Yemeni girls who would otherwise go hungry and be vulnerable to child marriage. •
We are proud to announce our partnership with grassroots organization @solidariosinfronteras to provide 25,000 breakfasts to schoolgirls in Sana’a, Yemen through our inaugural Laurel Borowick Grant. The $10,000 grant, named after a dear friend of the organization and our first major donor, will provide emergency assistance and education to girls in humanitarian settings where child marriage is exacerbated. •
This project in war-torn Yemen is one of many that you can help support by donating or sharing our posts during our Holiday fundraising and advocacy campaign throughout 16 Days of Activism Against Gender-Based Violence, until December 10th. •
Any amount will make a difference in the lives of vulnerable girls. We are offering several thank you gifts for donations, including 8.5x11 archival pigment prints, a gorgeous tote, a custom copper bangle - or all three! Please visit the link in our bio for more information. •
#givingtuesday #endchildmarriage #yemen #tooyoungtowed #givingtuesday #beauty

@kids4cause raises money for Leukemia & Lymphoma Society during second season.
.
Last August we spoke with mother-daughter duo Sowmya and Riya about Kids4Cause, their organization which allows kids to raise money for charity through long distance bicycle rides. In 2017, eight kids raised over $9,000 in the inaugural Kids4Cause event. On October 13 of this year, six kids rode the Wheels For Meals race with two more helping to raise over $4300 for the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (so far).
.
The new crop of riders was excited to join the team this season. The youngest rider was six years old and the others were all from Riya’s 5th grade class at Clarendon Elementary, a San Francisco public school. The highest fundraiser of the group, Samson, donated his birthday to the cause asking for donations instead of gifts. And within their community, the group had coaching help from a local high schooler, in addition to the parents of the children involved. A true group effort!
.
Link in bio to learn more 👆

“We’re trying to learn about people and how they adapt to space so that we can further them into the future.” - Sarah Wallace @nasa Microbiologist
.
We sat down with astronaut Kate Rubins 👩‍🚀 and microbiologist Sarah Wallace 👩‍🔬 to discuss the relationship between researchers on earth and astronauts in space. Hint: astronauts are the 🖐 👁 👂 of the researchers working on 🌍
.

.
.

Congratulations to New York Attorney General-Elect Letitia James!
James, New York City’s Public Advocate, made history on Election Day 2018 becoming the first woman in New York to be elected Attorney General.
.
James vowed to, as Attorney General, continue criminal justice reform, investigating cases of corruption, and defending the vulnerable citizens of New York.
Link in bio to learn more 👆 . 📷: Letitia James Twitter
.
.
.
.
Image description: A photo of a twitter post via Letitia James’ twitter account. Photo of James speaking with her hand raised and finger pointed. People around her are smiling and pointing at her in a celebratory manner. Twitter post reads: "This is a night for justice, a night for our future. I am proud to be a New Yorker who knows it’s our diversity, strength, courage and determination that makes us great. As your Attorney General I promise to fight for all of us.”
@nbcmakingit season 2 is now casting. Link in bio for more 🔨 👩‍🎤 🎨 #makingit

Repost from @staceyabrams .
.
From the bottom of my heart: Thank you.
.
I am so proud of the movement we built together. We redefined the politics of possible in the Deep South – but our fight is far from over.
•
When we kicked off our campaign in Albany almost a year and a half ago, we were told we’d never win the Democratic primary. That a candidate like me in a state like Georgia would not stand a chance. •

But we believe in Georgia. We believed in a new kind of campaign that respects every person and fights to earn, keep, and count every vote. And at every step of this journey, instead of falling prey to fear, instead of being blown off course by the winds of doubt, we forged on .
•
We reached out to communities across this state that very rarely see a candidate for governor. We activated and energized voters at a scale never before seen in Georgia Democratic politics. We won state House races, Senate races and a new seat in Congress. And we put America on notice that change is not coming – it has arrived. And you made it so .
•
This is only the beginning. We must keep fighting for the people who have always felt left behind, for the communities whose security and status are now in question. We must continue to stand united, to use the networks we’ve built and with the Georgians we’ve energized, to continue the fight for progress, for free and fair elections, and for equality.
•
Today, I announce the launch of Fair Fight Georgia, an operation that will pursue accountability in Georgia’s elections and integrity in the process of maintaining our voting rolls. We will channel the work of the past several weeks into a strong legal demand for reform of our election system in Georgia. And I will not waver in my commitment to work across party lines and across divisions to find a common purpose in protecting our democracy.
•
Our state has been at the forefront of speaking truth to whatever power may lay claim to leadership – if only for the moment. We will win because we are Georgia. And we WILL get it done.

Stacey Abrams
